section.name: How to install the embargo plugin

subsection.name: Prerequisites
subsection.p: These instruction assumes that you have an HST project based on the HST archetype, i.e. a Maven multiproject consisting of at least three submodules: cms, site and content.

subsection.name: Maven 2 repository
subsection.p: Add this repository to your root pom.xml (if it has not already been defined in a parent pom):

li.p: Add this property to the <properties> section of the root pom.xml: <properties> <bloomreach.forge.embargo.version>version</bloomreach.forge.embargo.version> </properties> Select the correct version for your project, see the release notes.
Add these two dependency to the pom.xml of your cms module (or cms-dependencies on 13 and up):
li.div: Note: before version 5.0.0, the artifacts' coordinates were org.onehippo.forge.embargo:embargo-addon-frontend and org.onehippo.forge.embargo:embargo-addon-repository, respectively.

li.p: Bloomreach 13 and up: add bootstrapping dependency to 'bloomreach-forge'.

In the project repository-data/application module (repository-data/application/src/main/resources/hcm-module.yaml), make sure your project configuration is bootstrapped after the group 'bloomreach-forge':
li.source: group: name: ... after: [hippo-cms, bloomreach-forge] project: ... module: ...

li.p: Rebuild your project. After startup, you should have the embargo workflow and an example embargo-enabled usergroup.
